docs.snippet: LEAD: President Reagan and President Miguel de la Madrid are to meet here Saturday with relations between the United States and Mexico smoother than at any time since they took office at the start of the decade....
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: President Reagan and President Miguel de la Madrid are to meet here Saturday with relations between the United States and Mexico smoother than at any time since they took office at the start of the decade.

headline.main: Better Ties Brighten U.S.-Mexican Summit Today

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: THE first great multi-holiday weekend has arrived. Thanks to a highly improbable convergence of several usually scattered midwinter holidays, Valentine's Day, the birthdays of America's first and 16th Presidents (now telescoped into a single, generic President's Day), and the warm-up to both Chinese New Year's and Mardi Gras (or

headline.main: A WEEKEND FOR LOVERS, PRESIDENTS AND DRAGONS

docs.snippet: LEAD: Six sets of remains, including one returned two and a half years ago, have been positively identified as Navy and Air Force fliers missing from the Vietnam War, the Pentagon said Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Six sets of remains, including one returned two and a half years ago, have been positively identified as Navy and Air Force fliers missing from the Vietnam War, the Pentagon said Tuesday.

headline.main: Remains of 6 Vietnam War Fliers Identified

docs.snippet: LEAD: President Oscar Arias shows a sense of urgency now in pushing for the next steps in his Central American peace plan. He rightly hailed the House vote against aid for Nicaragua's contras as an ''opportunity'' and a ''big responsibility for us...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: President Oscar Arias shows a sense of urgency now in pushing for the next steps in his Central American peace plan. He rightly hailed the House vote against aid for Nicaragua's contras as an ''opportunity'' and a ''big responsibility for us'' in Central America, not in itself decisive.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: THE troubles of the Marquez family are as amusing in Spanish as in English, and the tongues of its members may be sharper. Eduardo Machado's ''Revoltillo,'' one part of a trilogy about this Cuban-American clan that was first seen in English under the title ''Broken Eggs'' at the Ensemble Studio Theater in 1984, has now been added to the roster of Repertorio Espanol in

docs.snippet: LEAD: In an action reflecting the growing crisis in relations between Panama and the United States, the Panamanian Government has recalled three senior diplomats, including its Ambassador to Washington, for ''urgent consultations,'' state-controll...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: In an action reflecting the growing crisis in relations between Panama and the United States, the Panamanian Government has recalled three senior diplomats, including its Ambassador to Washington, for ''urgent consultations,'' state-controlled radio stations and newspapers here said today.

headline.main: PANAMA RECALLS ENVOYS FROM U.S. AS CRISIS DEEPENS

byline.original: By LARRY ROHTER, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: Since white settlers began arriving here 150 years ago, Natal has been known for its magnificent beaches and mountains, its sugar cane and a brand of racial politics as conservative as any in South Africa. Now some of its leading citizens ar...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Since white settlers began arriving here 150 years ago, Natal has been known for its magnificent beaches and mountains, its sugar cane and a brand of racial politics as conservative as any in South Africa. Now some of its leading citizens are promoting a plan for a multiracial government in the province, hoping that it will head off demands for black majority rule.

headline.main: Power-Sharing Plan Falters In a South African Province

byline.original: By JOHN F. BURNS, Special to the New York Times
